text: Magma is a French progressive rock band founded in Paris in 1969 by classically trained drummer Christian Vander. ==Studio albums== * 1970: Magma (reissued as Kobaïa) * 1971: 1001° Centigrades * 1973: Mëkanïk Dëstruktïẁ Kömmandöh initial copies of the CD included a vinyl rip of the album with a different version of the album as a bonus track * 1974: Ẁurdah Ïtah (originally released as Tristan & Iseult by Christian Vander) * 1974: Köhntarkösz initial copies of the CD included a vinyl rip of the album with a different version of the album as a bonus track * 1976: Üdü Ẁüdü * 1978: Attahk * 1984: Merci * 2004: K.A (Köhntarkösz Anteria) * 2009: Ëmëhntëhtt-Ré (CD + DVD) * 2012: Félicité Thösz * 2014: Rïah Sahïltaahk * 2015: Šlaǧ Tanƶ * 2019: ZëssMagma on Instagram: “5 days to start recording #magmamusic #christianvander #magmaband #2019 #magmazess” * 2022 Kartëhl ==References== Category:1969 establishments in France Category:French musical groups Category:Rock bands Category:Musical groups established in 1969 Category:Organizations based in Paris
title: Magma (band)
